p: The ESNEE (European Study of Neonatal Exposure to Excipients) clinical study [ 38] showed that sodium benzoate was found in 10 medicines given to new-borns, despite being a highly toxic excipient to them. Preservatives such as parabens (and their sodium salts) and propyl para-hydroxy-benzoate were also found in 24 paediatric medications, and ethanol in 8.
